current_task: Downloading pre-built Solr indexes - recording.tar.zst in progress
message: Good questions! The live indexer (amqp_watch) is NOT currently running. After loading the pre-built indexes, we'll need to manually start it. Here are the answers:

answers.q1_is_indexer_configured: Yes, the indexer container is running and configured (config at default/indexer.ini with RabbitMQ settings). But the amqp_watch daemon is NOT running - it must be started manually.
answers.q2_will_it_autostart: No. The amqp_watch daemon doesn't auto-start with the container. After loading indexes, I need to run: podman-compose exec -d indexer python -m sir amqp_watch
answers.q3_will_it_catch_up: Yes, once amqp_watch is running. The system uses PostgreSQL triggers + RabbitMQ to queue changes. The AMQP queues should have any changes since Dec 6 waiting to be processed.

action_plan_after_indexes_load: 1. Run load-backup-archives to restore Solr indexes
3. Start live indexer: podman-compose exec -d indexer python -m sir amqp_watch
4. Verify AMQP processing: podman exec mq rabbitmqctl list_queues
notes: Recording is the largest index (35+ million docs). Once it finishes, release.tar.zst is also very large. ETA still 1-2 hours.
